name: Hamid Reza Saadi Dadmarzi
tagline: M.Sc. Researcher • Secure Computation • Privacy-Preserving ML
summary: I am currently an M.Sc. student in Computer Science at Koç University (Istanbul), where I work under the supervision of Prof. Alptekin Küpçü. My research centers on password-based authentication protocols, SMPC-based designs, and performance-driven cryptographic engineering. My work combines rigorous security arguments with real-world benchmarking, including Rust/Go implementations and Dockerized experimental frameworks. I graduated from the Polytechnic University of Tehran with an M.Sc. in Applied Mathematics, where my research focused on quantum error correction and surface codes. I also worked on quantum kernels for neural networks using Qiskit and PyQuil.
highlights: Research across SMPC, privacy-preserving ML, and post-quantum cryptography (first-author projects in progress).
External reviewer for IEEE TIFS, ACM ASIACCS 2024 and 2026, ACNS 2026, JISAS 2025,Royal society open science 2024 and the Turkish Journal of Electrical Engineering & Computer Sciences.
Curating a PQC Application Atlas: 90+ papers (2020–present) organized into 19 application domains.

details: Research focus: Password based authentication schemes(SMPC), Post-Quantum Cryptography and Privacy-preserving ML.
Affiliation: Koç University, Dept. of Engineering.
Research focus:Quantum error correcting codes, Surface codes, information theoretic cryptography.
Courses:Quantum Mechanics 1,2, Statical mechanics 1,2, Electromagnetism 1,2, Advanced Electrodynamics, Advanced Quantum mechanics 1,...
Ranked in the top 5% among all students.

experience.role: Crypto screeners & automated asset management bots
bullets: Developed personalized market screeners and automated crypto asset management bots using Golang and Docker.

experience.org: Institute for Research in Fundamental Sciences (IPM)
bullets: Optimized quantum kernels for neural networks using Qiskit and PyQuil.
Developed a data warehouse and integrated data using Excel and Tableau.

researchProjects.title: Updatable Distributed Password-Protected Sharing (UpSPA)
researchProjects.summary: Designed and strengthened an updatable SMPC scheme; authored ideal/real simulation proofs under malicious adversaries; enhanced protocol design; evaluated performance in Rust, Golang, and Docker.
highlights: Ideal/real simulation proofs under malicious adversaries.
Protocol design improvements + performance evaluation (Rust/Go, containerized benchmarks).

researchProjects.title: Post-Quantum Secure SPA Framework
researchProjects.summary: Extending the UpSPA concept to a post-quantum secure framework using a KEM with three properties; building UC-security proofs for adaptive malicious adversaries and benchmarking against UpSPA and existing SSO schemes.
highlights: Performance benchmarking vs UpSPA + existing SSO schemes.

researchProjects.title: CURE Project (privacy-preserving ML with FHE)
researchProjects.summary: Assisted in developing privacy-preserving ML models using Lattigo (Golang), implementing and debugging CKKS-based FHE and bootstrapping modules.
highlights: Implemented + debugged CKKS/FHE components and bootstrapping modules in Go (Lattigo).

researchProjects.title: Frequency Domain DP-FL
researchProjects.summary: Developing a frequency-domain differential privacy framework for communication-efficient federated learning, integrating Fourier-based grouping with tight DP accounting.

researchProjects.title: PQC Application Atlas
researchProjects.summary: Curating a comprehensive survey of post-quantum cryptography applications: 90+ papers (2020–present) organized into 19 domains in Overleaf, planned as a public reference website inspired by the Error Correction Zoo.
highlights: Planned public reference website (Error Correction Zoo-inspired).

manual.name: UpSPA vs TSPA Benchmarks
manual.description: Unified, reproducible benchmark suite measuring client phases, primitives, server/storage-provider primitives, LAN/WAN network simulation, and modeled end-to-end totals for UpSPA/TSPA.

manual.name: UpSPA_FPB
manual.description: Multi-component UpSPA codebase (Rust crates + Go storage-provider service + docs/scripts tooling).

manual.name: TSPA Benchmark
manual.description: Manual, reproducible client-side micro-benchmarks for a Threshold SPA-style protocol (registration + authentication; deterministic RNG; scriptable outputs).

honorsAwards: Recognized as an Outstanding Teaching Assistant for the Computer Networks and Security course; awarded a top-up conference travel allowance (8,000 TL), Spring 2025.
Awarded double major recognition from the Exceptional Talent Center at the university.
Admitted to the Master of Science program without a national entrance exam (Exceptional Talent Center).
Ranked in the top 5% among all students in the B.Sc. program.
